sen.j: 伏見街道（ふしみかいどう）は、京（京都）の五条通と伏見とを結ぶ街道。

sen.j: 大津宿と伏見宿 (京街道)を結ぶ街道。
sen.e: The Fushimi-kaido also refers to a road that links Otsu-juku and Fushimi-shuku (Kyo-kaido Road).

sen.j: 京都の五条通（京都市東山区）を北の起点とし、鴨川東岸を南下して、伏見（京都市伏見区）の京町通につながる街道である。
sen.e: It starts from the Gojo-dori Street (the Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City) in the north, runs south along the eastern bank of the Kamo-gawa River, and leads to the Kyomachi-dori Street in Fushimi (the Fushimi ward, Kyoto City).

It starts from the Gojo-dori Street (the Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City) in the north, runs south along the eastern bank of the Kamo-gawa River, and leads to the Kyomachi-dori Street in Fushimi (the Fushimi ward, Kyoto City).

It starts from the Gojo-dori Street (the Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City) in the north, runs south along the eastern bank of the Kamo-gawa River, and leads to the Kyomachi-dori Street in Fushimi (the Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉によって開かれたといわれる。
sen.e: It is said to have been built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
It is said to have been built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
It is said to have been built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 江戸時代から、京と伏見とをつなぐ観光の道として賑わった。
sen.e: It was a busy street as a sightseeing route that links Kyo and Fushimi since the Edo era.
It has existed as a busy street and sightseeing route that links Kyo and Fushimi since the Edo era.
It has existed as a busy street and sightseeing route that links Kyo and Fushimi since the Edo era.

sen.j: 現在では都市間交通の役割を約1km西に並行する竹田街道などに譲って、地域の生活道路となっている。
sen.e: It has yielded the role of an intercity highway to other roads such as the Takeda-kaido paralleling 1 km west,and today serves as a community road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則除外
sen.e: It now functions as an intercity highway and a connection to other roads such as the Takeda-kaido which runs parallel 1 km west,and today serves as a community road.
It now functions as an intercity highway and a connection to other roads such as the Takeda-kaido Road which runs parallel 1 km west,and today serves as a community road.

sen.j: 北側にある東山区あたりでは、本町通 (京都)（ほんまちどおり）、南側にある伏見区深草あたりでは直違橋通（すじかいばしどおり）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The northern part of the road in the Higashiyama Ward is called Honmachi-dori Street, and the southern part of the road around Fukakusa, Fushimi Ward is called Sujikaibashi-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則除外
sen.e: The northern part of the road in the Higashiyama Ward is called Honmachi-dori Street, and the southern part of the road around Fukakusa, Fushimi Ward is called Sujikaibashi-dori Street.
The northern part of the road in the Higashiyama Ward is called Honmachi-dori Street (Kyoto), and the southern part of the road around Fukakusa, Fushimi Ward is called Sujikaibashi-dori Street.

sen.j: また、京阪本線が並行して走っている。
sen.e: The Keihan Main Line also runs in parallel.
The Keihan Main Line also runs in parallel.
The Keihan Main Line also runs in parallel.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が、関白を辞し伏見に居を移すにあたって、天正年間あるいは文禄年間に京と伏見を結ぶ道として開いたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said to have been built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Tempo era or Bunroku period, when he stepped down as chief adviser to the Emperor and moved to Fushimi.
It is said to have been built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Tempo era or Bunroku period, when he stepped down as chief adviser to the Emperor and moved to Fushimi.
It is said to have been built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Tenpo era or Bunroku period, when he stepped down as chief adviser to the Emperor and moved to Fushimi.

sen.j: 江戸時代の伏見は交通の要衝であり、京と伏見の間の物資の運搬路として、この伏見街道に並行して、陸路の竹田街道や、水路の高瀬川 (京都府)水運が開かれた。
sen.e: During the Edo era Fushimi was a traffic hub because theTakeda-kaido Road for an overland route and theTakase-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) channel for a water route were developed in parallel with the Fushimi Kaido for transporting goods between Kyo and Fushimi.

During the Edo era Fushimi was a traffic hub because the Takeda-kaido Road abd the Takase-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) channel were developed at the same time as the Fushimi Kaiso for use as a land route and water route respectively to transport goods between Kyo and Fushimi.

During the Edo period Fushimi was a traffic hub because the Takeda-kaido Road and the Takase-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) channel were developed at the same time as the Fushimi-kaido Road for use as a land route and water route respectively to transport goods between Kyo and Fushimi.

sen.j: しかし、当時の旅の中心は徒歩であり、稲荷神社（現在の伏見稲荷大社）をはじめ沿道に名所が多いこの道は、観光の道として旅人の往来が多く、沿道には京から伏見に掛けて家屋が連担し、にぎわいを見せた。
sen.e: In those days, however, people commonly travel by foot, therefore the Fushimi-kaido Road having Inari-jinja Shrine (present Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine) and many other sightseeing spots was busy with sightseeners traveling it and many houses were found in particular around Kyo and Fushimi.

In those days, however, people commonly travel by foot, and the Fushimi-kaido Road, with the Inari-jinja Shrine (present Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine) and many other sightseeing spots was busy with sightseeers who travelled along the road and many houses were found in around Kyo and Fushimi.

In those days, however, people commonly travel by foot, and the Fushimi-kaido Road, with the Inari-jinja Shrine (present Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine) and many other sightseeing spots was busy with sightseers who travelled along the road and many houses were found in around Kyo and Fushimi.

sen.j: 近代に入り、日本初の路面電車が竹田街道に沿って京都と伏見を結ぶなど鉄道が整備された。
sen.e: In the modern times, railways such as Japan's first tram linking Kyo and Fushimi were built along theTakeda-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則除外
sen.e: In modern times, railways such as Japan's first tram linking Kyo and Fushimi were built along the Takeda-kaido Road.
In modern times, railways such as Japan's first tram linking Kyo and Fushimi were built along the Takeda-kaido Road.

sen.j: また、車両中心の道路交通としてのメインストリートとしての役割は現在の国道24号・竹田街道や国道1号が担うことになり、主要な交通路としての地位を譲ることになった。
sen.e: It has yielded the role of a highway to the National Highway route No. 24 (Takeda-kaido-Road) and the National Highway route No.1, which now serve as a vehicle-oriented main street.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則除外
sen.e: It has turned into a highway for the National Highway route No. 24 (Takeda-kaido-Road) and the National Highway route No.1, which now acts as a main street.
It has turned into a highway for the National Highway route No. 24 (Takeda-kaido-Road) and the National Highway route No. 1, which now acts as a main street.

sen.j: しかし、現在でもなお地域の生活道路として重要な街路であり、道幅が狭くほぼ全区間で二輪車を除いて北向き一方通行であるが車両の交通量も多い。
sen.e: The Fushimi-kaido Road, however, is an important community road, though narrow one-way traffic toward the north for all automobiles except for two-wheeled vehicles.in almost all the sections.
The Fushimi-kaido Road, however, is an important community road, through narrow one-way traffic toward the north for all automobiles except for two-wheeled vehicles.in almost all the sections.

sen.j: また、家屋の更新により新しい建物も多いが、古くからある町屋も散見され、街道として栄えた面影を残している。
sen.e: Also, although many reconstructed new-style buildings are found along the street, traditional town houses remain in some sections, showing its past prosper as a highway in the old days.
Also, although many reconstructed new-style buildings are found along the street, traditional town houses remain in some sections, showcasing its past as a prosperous highway from days gone by.
Also, although many reconstructed new-style buildings are found along the street, traditional town houses remain in some sections, showcasing its past as a prosperous highway from days gone by.

sen.j: 鴨川に架かる五条大橋東詰から三筋目が北の起点である。
sen.e: It starts from a point three blocks north of Gojo-ohashi Higashizume (east foot of Gojo-Ohashi bridge) crossing the Kamo-gawa River.

sen.j: そこから鴨川東岸、東山の山麓を南下して、東福寺、伏見稲荷大社の前を通り、墨染の交差点で墨染通を西に進む。
sen.e: Starting from that point, it runs south down a mountain in Higashiyama, passes in front of Tofuku-ji Temple and Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine, goes into the Sumizome-dori Street, and runs west at the Sumizome Crossing.

sen.j: 墨染寺の角で再び南に折れ、撞木町の前を通り、国道24号を交差し京町通につながる。
sen.e: It bends again south at the corner of Bokusen-ji Temple, passes in front of Shumoku-mach, crosses the National highway Route No, 24, and joins the Kyomachi-dori Street.

tit.j: 法性寺大路と伏見街道

sen.j: 京都の鴨川東岸には、古くから奈良へ至る道が通っており、平安時代に鴨川東岸に広く勢力を有していた法性寺の名から、法性寺路または法性寺大路と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Since the ancient times, there have been a road to Nanara along the eastern side of the Kamogawa River in Kyoto, and it was named Hosshoji-michi Street or Hossho-ji-Oji after Hossho-ji Temple, which held a great power over the area along the eastern bank of the Kamogawa River.

Since ancient times, there has been a road to Nanara along the eastern side of the Kamogawa River in Kyoto, and it was named Hosshoji-michi Street or Hossho-ji-Oji after Hossho-ji Temple, which held great power over the area along the eastern bank of the Kamogawa River.

Since ancient times, there has been a road to Nara along the eastern side of the Kamo-gawa River in Kyoto, and it was named Hosshoji-michi Street or Hossho-ji-Oji after Hossho-ji Temple, which held great power over the area along the eastern bank of the Kamo-gawa River.

sen.j: 伏見街道はこの法性寺大路とは近接しながらも、若干東側のルートを取ったようである。

The Fushimi-kaido Road seems to approach Hosshoji-Oji Street but takes a slightly eastern route.

sen.j: 東山の山麓から流れる川に対して、4本の橋が架けられ、それぞれ北から一ノ橋、二ノ橋、三ノ橋、四ノ橋といわれた。
sen.e: There were 4 bridges crossing a river running from mountains in Higashiyama, each of which was called Ichino-hashi bridge, Nino-hashi bridge, Sanno-hashi bridge, and Shino-hashi bridge from the north.

sen.j: 一ノ橋、二ノ橋は掛けられていた川が暗渠化されてしまった。

sen.j: が三ノ橋や四ノ橋と同時期に設置された橋の親柱が、一ノ橋は一橋小学校の校庭、二ノ橋は九条高架橋の下に残されている。
sen.e: However, their newel posts, which were built when the Sanno-hashi bridge and the Shino-hashi bridge were built, remain on a school yard of Ikkyo Elementary School for the Ichino-hashi bridge and under the Kujo Elevated Bridge for the Nino-hashi bridge.

sen.j: 東山区内では、五条から南に向かって、本町一丁目から本町二十二丁目までナンバリングされた町通りが道路の両側に形成されている。

In the Higashiyama Ward towns having names with numbers from 1 to 22--1 chome, Honmachi to 22 chome Honmachi--are arranged on both sides of the Fushimi-kaido Road starting from Gojo to the south.
sen.cmt: to the south補足スペルを修正

sen.j: （本町五丁目の北に本町新五丁目、本町六丁目の北に本町新六丁目があり、全部で24町。）
sen.e: (There are the total of 24 towns including Hommachi Shin 5 chome (north of 5 chome, Hommachi) and Hommachi Shin 6 chome (north of 6 chome, Hommachi.)
(There are a total of 24 towns including Hommachi Shin 5 chome (north of 5 chome, Hommachi) and Hommachi Shin 6 chome (north of 6 chome, Hommachi.)
(There are a total of 24 towns including Honmachi Shin 5 chome (north of 5 chome, Honmachi) and Honmachi Shin 6 chome (north of 6 chome, Honmachi.)
sen.cmt: スペルを修正スペース削除

sen.j: また、伏見区深草では、直違橋の南側に深草直違橋南一丁目、北側に深草直違橋北一丁目があり、深草直違橋北一丁目の北に、北に向かって深草直違橋二丁目から深草直違橋十一丁目までナンバリングされた町通りが道路の両側に形成されている。
sen.e: Fukakusa, Fushimi ward has 1 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi-Minami north of the Sujikai-bashi bridge and 1 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi-Kita south of the Sujikai-bashi bridge, and in addition, towns having names with numbers from 2 to 11--2 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi to 11 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi--are arranged north in the both sides of the Fushimi-kaido Road.

Fukakusa, Fushimi ward has 1 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi-Minami north of the Sujikai-bashi bridge and 1 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi-Kita south of the Sujikai-bashi bridge, and in addition, towns having names with numbers from 2 to 11--2 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi to 11 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi--are arranged north on both sides of the Fushimi-kaido Road.

Fukakusa, Fushimi Ward has 1 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi-Minami south of the Sujikai-bashi bridge and 1 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi-Kita north of the Sujikai-bashi bridge, and in addition, towns having names with numbers from 2 to 11--2 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi to 11 Chome, Fukakusa-Sujikaibashi--are arranged north on both sides of the Fushimi-kaido Road.

sen.j: 京都中心部から南下して、伏見中心部とを結ぶ道路、水路、鉄道は以下のものがある。
sen.e: The roads, water channels, and railways that start south from the central Kyoto and lead to central Fushimi include the following.

sen.j: 京都側では伏見街道がこれらの最も東側に位置している。
sen.e: The Fushimi-kaido Road is located in the east most of them in Kyoto..
